content: That's pretty fantastic. Do you know if the source is available anywhere?
Note that it does not do dependency resolution according to Cargos ruols. For example it will happily have foo = 1.1 and foo = 1.2 in the same graph.

@Tony Arcieri I need new releases of rustsec and rustsec-admin to migrate prod to exporting OSV v0.8. Do you have a particular workflow set up for that? I could push the releases myself but I don't want to disrupt an existing convention.
I believe we should bump the minor version because the feature is called osv-I-know-this-is-unstable and the API break does not affect anyone who doesn't use OSV. Or, well, it shouldn't at any rate.
I just cut normal releases and then bump the version pinned in the advisory-db's GH actions config
OSV v0.8 has been promoted to v1.0; I suppose I'll keep the setup explicitly labeled unstable for now and we can stabilize our data structures mapping to that later.
@Shnatsel I mean, the whole crate is "unstable". You can probably remove the scare language from the feature itself
